title.rendered: Columbia University Acceptance Rate, SAT/ACT Requirements, Tuition

content.rendered:
Looking for the Columbia University Acceptance Rate for 2027 class? The Columbia University has reported her Acceptance Rate. This page provide guides to get into Columbia University 2027.

Columbia University Acceptance Rate

The Columbia University acceptance rate refers to the percentage of applicants who are admitted to the university for a given academic year. It is calculated by dividing the number of applicants who are offered admission by the total number of applicants who applied for that year.

For example, if Columbia University received 50,000 applications for the class of 2025 and offered admission to 1,850 students, the acceptance rate would be calculated as follows:

Acceptance rate = (1,850 / 50,000) x 100% = 3.7%

The acceptance rate is an important indicator of the competitiveness of the admissions process at Columbia University. A lower acceptance rate typically indicates a more selective and competitive admissions process, while a higher acceptance rate suggests a less competitive process.

For the class of 2027, Columbia University reported an acceptance rate of 3.9%. This is a highly competitive acceptance rate, and it indicates that the admissions process at Columbia University is very selective.
